intro: Thrixspermum xanthanthum, commonly known as the golden thrixspermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique texture. The species is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
